page.title: 01Percy Cross Rigg N Yorks
page.content: Percy Cross Rig takes its name from the 13th Century cross which marks the ancient Guisborough to Westerdale Road. Over 260 metres above sea level th ridge runs south west from Hutton Moor to Garden Bank Wood in Kildale. To the north lies the broad, flat dale of Sleddale with Gisborough grouse moor beyond. Marshy areas called slacks and abundant springs feed Sleddale Beck which forms the county boundary between the parishes of Commondale and Kildale. Old field systems, cairns and Romano-British remains are evidence of mans occupation of this now lonely area within the North York Moors National Park. South west of the ridge lies Lonsdale drained by Lonsale Beck and farmed, with areas of managed coniferous woodland on the highland. There is a small settlement at
